title: Pizza Palooza
description:
Pizza Palooza is a modern React application for online pizza ordering, focused on a seamless user experience and responsive design. Built with React 18, TypeScript, React Router 6, and Tailwind CSS, it demonstrates advanced front-end patterns and state management using Redux Toolkit.

Key features include:

  • Dynamic Menu: Fetches pizza data from an API with real-time availability
  • Cart Management: Add, remove, and adjust quantities with persistent state
  • Priority Orders: Upgrade orders with price confirmation dialogs and delivery time estimation
  • Responsive Design: Fully optimized for both mobile and desktop

This project showcases modern React patterns including component composition, data fetching via React Router loaders/actions, and TypeScript for end-to-end type safety.

title: Ace Remodeling Toolkit
description:
Ace Remodeling Toolkit is a real-world internal CRM built for a residential remodeling company, designed to streamline project management using Google Sheets and Apps Script. This freelance consulting project demonstrates full ownership of a live operational system used by multiple team members.

  • CRM Automation: Automates dashboard generation, project setup, and cost tracking in Google Sheets
  • Script Library: Refactored legacy code into modular, reusable functions with centralized config
  • Deployment Pipeline: Used clasp and GitHub for version control and multi-account script updates
  • Real Business Impact: Reduced manual overhead and improved data reliability across active construction projects

title: Traveler
description:
Traveler is a modern front-end travel log application built with React, TypeScript, and Vite. It enables users to track and visualize their journeys with a clean, intuitive interface.

  • Location Management: Add and organize cities and countries you've visited
  • Interactive Map: Visualize your travels (map integration planned)
  • Responsive Design: Optimized for both desktop and mobile use
  • Modern Tech Stack: Built with React, Vite, and TypeScript

This front-end-only project demonstrates strong state management, clean architecture, and a focus on user experience. Future updates will include map integration using Leaflet or Mapbox, and shared state with the Context API.

title: YelpCamp
description:
YelpCamp is a full-stack web application that allows users to explore, create, and review campgrounds across the United States. Built with Express.js and MongoDB, it implements full CRUD functionality, user authentication via Passport.js, and dynamic page rendering using EJS. Image uploads are handled through Cloudinary, creating a rich and interactive experience.

This project highlights backend development, RESTful API design, and deployment readiness.

title: Quizzy
description:
Quizzy is a single-page application (SPA) built with React and Vite that tests users on various subjects. It features a dynamic scoring system, a countdown timer for each question, and a progress bar for quiz tracking.

The app uses functional components and React hooks for state management, with a clean and responsive UI styled in plain CSS.
